Consider a linear system characterized by the integral transformation \\( y(t) = \\int_0^t e^{A(s-t)} x(s) ds \\), with A being a constant square matrix. The input function \\( x(t) \\) is transformed using the function \\( g(t, x) = e^{Bt} x \\), where B is also a constant matrix.

Can we determine the original function \\( x_0(t) \\) after observing \\( y(T) \\) without knowing whether \\( g(t, x) \\) was applied?
Explanation: Without knowing if \\( g(t, x) \\) was applied, it is not possible to accurately trace back to the original form of \\( x_0(t) \\) because the transformation via \\( e^{Bt} \\) could have significantly altered the input, affecting the resultant function \\( y(T) \\) in a way that does not uniquely correspond to any specific \\( x_0(t) \\).
